advanced.q: If you _____ water to 100°C at standard pressure, it always boils.
advanced.exp: Zero conditional uses present simple in both clauses for universal truths.

advanced.q: Should the minister resign, the government _____ into constitutional crisis.
advanced.exp: Inverted first conditional: 'should + subject' = 'if + present simple', main clause uses 'will'.

advanced.q: Unless the board _____ immediate action, shareholders will demand a public inquiry.
advanced.exp: 'Unless' means 'if not' and requires present simple in first conditional.

advanced.q: If I _____ any further information, I shall contact you immediately.
advanced.exp: First conditional: present simple in if-clause, 'shall' (formal) or 'will' in main clause.

advanced.q: Provided that parliament _____ the bill, implementation will commence in April.
advanced.exp: 'Provided that' (conditional conjunction) takes present simple for future conditions.

advanced.q: Should it emerge that funds _____ diverted, regulatory action will follow.
advanced.exp: After 'should it emerge that', use past simple (were) for hypothetical discovery.

advanced.q: If the accused _____ to appear, a warrant will be issued forthwith.
advanced.exp: First conditional: present simple after 'if' for real future possibility.

advanced.q: Unless reform _____ implemented, the system will continue to deteriorate.
advanced.exp: 'Unless' + present simple passive for real negative condition.

proficient.q: Were the allegations to prove substantiated, the administration _____ irreparably discredited.
proficient.exp: Inverted second conditional: 'were + subject + to-infinitive' (formal hypothetical), main clause uses 'would'.

proficient.q: Should it transpire that documents _____ systematically falsified, criminal charges may ensue.
proficient.exp: 'Should it transpire that' + past simple for discovered past action.

proficient.q: If the tribunal _____ to uphold the appeal, precedent would be fundamentally altered.
proficient.exp: Subjunctive 'were' (not 'was') in formal hypothetical present condition.

proficient.q: Supposing the merger _____ through, thousands of redundancies would inevitably follow.
proficient.exp: 'Supposing' (conditional) + past simple for hypothetical future scenario.

proficient.q: Were Parliament to be prorogued unexpectedly, a constitutional crisis _____ unavoidable.
proficient.exp: Inverted second conditional with 'were + to-infinitive' (formal hypothetical future).

proficient.q: Should the electorate _____ differently, the political landscape would be transformed.
proficient.exp: 'Should + subject + base form' = inverted first conditional (possible future).

advanced.q: If the government _____ earlier, the economic crisis might have been averted.
advanced.exp: Third conditional: past perfect in if-clause for unreal past condition.

advanced.q: Were it not for the intervention of the central bank, the market _____ collapsed entirely.
advanced.exp: Inverted second conditional: 'were it not for' (present unreal), main clause 'would have' (past result).

advanced.q: If negotiations _____ more productively, an agreement might have been reached.
advanced.exp: Third conditional: past perfect for unreal past action affecting past result.

advanced.q: Had the minister _____ transparent, the scandal could have been avoided.
advanced.exp: Inverted third conditional: 'had + subject + past participle'.

advanced.q: If the evidence _____ available earlier, the verdict would have differed.
advanced.exp: Third conditional: past perfect for unreal past circumstance.

advanced.q: Were the prime minister _____ unexpectedly, the deputy would assume office.
advanced.exp: Inverted second conditional: 'were + subject + to-infinitive' for hypothetical future.

advanced.q: If the committee _____ due diligence, the irregularities would have been detected.
advanced.exp: Third conditional: past perfect for unreal past action.

advanced.q: Had whistleblowers not _____ forward, the fraud might never have been exposed.
advanced.exp: Inverted third conditional: 'had + subject + past participle'.

proficient.q: Had it not been for the whistleblower's intervention, the malpractice _____ undetected indefinitely.
proficient.exp: Inverted third conditional: 'had it not been for' (unreal past), requires perfect conditional 'might have + past participle'.

proficient.q: If the allegations _____ substantiated beyond doubt, the implications would be far-reaching.
proficient.exp: Subjunctive 'were' (not 'was') for formal hypothetical present condition in unreal context.

proficient.q: Were successive administrations _____ fiscal prudence, the deficit would not exist today.
proficient.exp: Mixed conditional: 'were + to have + past participle' (unreal past) → present result.

proficient.q: Had the regulators _____ their statutory duty, the systemic failures would have been prevented.
proficient.exp: Inverted third conditional: 'had + subject + past participle' (formal past unreal).

proficient.q: If it _____ for entrenched vested interests, reform would have been implemented long ago.
proficient.exp: Third conditional: 'if it hadn't been for' (unreal past reason) → past result with 'would have'.

proficient.q: Were the tribunal _____ jurisdiction, the case would proceed to the Supreme Court.
proficient.exp: Inverted second conditional: 'were + subject + to-infinitive' for hypothetical present.

advanced.q: If the economic policy _____ implemented differently, unemployment would not be so high today.
advanced.exp: Mixed conditional: past perfect (unreal past action) → present conditional result.

advanced.q: If I _____ that position when offered, I would be working in Brussels now.
advanced.exp: Mixed third→second: past perfect for past decision → present conditional result.

advanced.q: Were I _____ at the time, I would have intervened immediately.
advanced.exp: Inverted mixed conditional: 'were + subject + adjective' (past context) → past result.

advanced.q: If she _____ more diplomatic in her approach, relations would not have deteriorated.
advanced.exp: Third conditional: past perfect for unreal past behavior → past result.

advanced.q: Had the infrastructure _____ properly, the current transport crisis would not exist.
advanced.exp: Mixed conditional: inverted past perfect passive (past) → present result.

advanced.q: If successive governments _____ in education, standards would be higher today.
advanced.exp: Mixed conditional: past perfect (past inaction) → present consequence.

proficient.q: Had the chancellor _____ greater fiscal prudence earlier, the economy would not be in recession now.
proficient.exp: Mixed third→second: inverted past perfect (past action) → present conditional result.

proficient.q: If successive administrations _____ infrastructure systematically, the transport system would function efficiently today.
proficient.exp: Mixed conditional: past perfect (continuous past failure) → present result.

proficient.q: Were it not that the defendant _____ a diplomatic passport, extradition proceedings would have commenced.
proficient.exp: Mixed inverted: 'were it not that' (present fact) → past conditional result.

proficient.q: Had the electorate _____ more discerningly, the current political impasse would not have arisen.
proficient.exp: Third conditional: inverted past perfect (past action) → past result.

proficient.q: If the regulatory framework _____ more robust historically, such systemic failures would be unthinkable today.
proficient.exp: Mixed conditional: past perfect (past state) → present conditional result.

proficient.q: Were the opposition _____ a viable alternative previously, the government would have lost the election.
proficient.exp: Mixed inverted: 'were + to have + past participle' (unreal past) → past result.

advanced.q: _____ the minister to resign abruptly, his deputy would assume the portfolio temporarily.
advanced.exp: Inverted conditional: 'Were + subject + to-infinitive' for formal hypothetical future event.

advanced.q: The legislation will not pass _____ the government secures cross-party support.
advanced.exp: 'Unless' = 'if not'; expresses negative condition (will not pass if support NOT secured).

advanced.q: _____ the defendant to be acquitted, public confidence in the judiciary would be severely undermined.
advanced.exp: 'Were + subject + to-infinitive': formal inverted conditional for hypothetical outcome.

advanced.q: Negotiations will proceed smoothly _____ both parties demonstrate flexibility.
advanced.exp: 'Provided' (= 'provided that') expresses positive condition: only if this happens.

advanced.q: _____ the board approved the merger, shareholder consent would still be required.
advanced.exp: 'Even if' + past simple for hypothetical concessive condition (contrasts with main clause).

advanced.q: The policy will succeed _____ adequate resources are allocated.
advanced.exp: 'Only if' (= 'provided that') expresses necessary condition: must have this.

proficient.q: _____ the tribunal to uphold the original ruling, constitutional precedent would be fundamentally altered.
proficient.exp: 'Were + subject + to-infinitive': formal inverted second conditional for hypothetical future legal outcome.

proficient.q: The negotiations might have succeeded _____ both parties shown greater flexibility from the outset.
proficient.exp: 'Had + subject + past participle': inverted third conditional (unreal past condition).

proficient.q: _____ systemic reform to be implemented comprehensively, decades of entrenched dysfunction must be addressed.
proficient.exp: 'For + noun/infinitive + to-infinitive': formal structure expressing necessary condition.

proficient.q: The defendant would face prosecution _____ for the diplomatic immunity he currently enjoys.
proficient.exp: 'Were it not for': inverted second conditional expressing present contrary-to-fact reason.

proficient.q: _____ the minister to have resigned earlier, the scandal might never have escalated so dramatically.
proficient.exp: 'Had + subject + past participle': inverted third conditional (unreal past action → past result).

proficient.q: The policy would never have been adopted _____ for the prime minister's personal intervention.
proficient.exp: 'Had it not been for': inverted third conditional expressing past contrary-to-fact reason.

proficient.q: _____ to the proposal being approved unanimously, implementation will commence immediately.
proficient.exp: 'Subject to': formal phrase meaning 'conditional upon' or 'depending on'.

proficient.q: Sentencing will be deferred _____ the psychiatric assessment is completed satisfactorily.
proficient.exp: 'Pending' (= 'until') expresses temporal condition: waiting for this to happen.
